Row.Text: Grant a free [ICON_GreatGeneral] Great General when built, +10 Loyalty to all owned cities.

Built in 1967 as a monument to the power of the Soviet Union and as a memorial to those that gave their lives during the battle of Stalingrad, The Motherland Calls is the world's tallest non-religious statue, standing at 91 metres to the tip of the sword. Leading to the statue are 200 stairs, one to mark each day of the battle of Stalingrad.
“One of the hallmarks of a great nation, is it ability to raise to its feet after a fall.”[NEWLINE]– Vasily Osipovich Klyuchevsky

Replace.Text: 建成时获得一个 [ICON_GreatGeneral] 大将军，所有城市+10忠诚度。
为了纪念在斯大林格勒保卫战中牺牲的将士，苏联于1967年在伏尔加格勒（今伏尔加格勒）建成这座纪念碑——“祖国母亲在召唤”。它是世界上最高的非宗教雕像，总高91米，200级台阶引领其上，台阶数象征着斯大林格勒保卫战的持续天数。
一个国家之所以伟大，在于它拥有在跌倒时重新站起来的能力。[NEWLINE]——瓦西里·奥西波维奇·克柳切夫斯基
